main_definition: To move quickly towards a particular point or to increase rapidly in speed, size, or intensity.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A verb meaning to go somewhere very fast, especially using power (like an engine).
meanings_and_examples.example: The car zoomed down the highway at incredible speed.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To adjust the focus or distance on a camera lens rapidly.
meanings_and_examples.example: She zoomed in on the tiny details of the painting with her camera.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A verb referring to expanding images, typically through digital enlargement, making them appear larger and clearer.
meanings_and_examples.example: He used a photo editing software to zoom into the picture so he could see more detail.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An adjective describing something that happens very quickly or suddenly.
meanings_and_examples.example: Their relationship took off like a rocket, zooming from friendship to love in no time.
